perturbation.changed_text: 3.2 PAYMENT TERMS. Except as provided in Section 2.1 above, and unless otherwise agreed and specified in Exhibit A, all amounts due and owing by HSNS shall be paid within sixty (60) days from the date of E.piphany's invoice. perturbation.explanation: This change extends the payment term to 60 days and increases the late payment charge. California law, which governs this agreement, may have regulations on maximum late payment fees and accepted payment terms. Raising the late payment charge to 3% per month could be considered usurious and violate California's usury laws, depending on the context and nature of the agreement. The original 30 day term aligns more closely with standard business practice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Usury Law, potential violation of contract law regarding reasonable payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 9.1 CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION. By virtue of this Agreement, each party may have access to information that is confidential to the other party. "Confidential Information" shall consist of the Application, Documentation, the terms and pricing under this Agreement, and all information clearly identified as confidential at the time of disclosure (or, in the case of information disclosed orally, within thirty (30) days of the date of disclosure). Confidential Information shall not include information that: (i) is or becomes a part of the public domain through no act or omission of the other party; (ii) was in the other party's lawful possession prior to the disclosure and had not been obtained by the other party either directly or indirectly from the disclosing party; (iii) is lawfully disclosed to the other party by a third party without restriction on disclosure; or (iv) is independently developed by the other party. HSNS shall not disclose the results of any Application benchmark tests to any third party without E.piphany's prior written approval. The parties agree to hold each other's Confidential Information in confidence for a period of five (5) years after disclosure of the Confidential Information or for a period of two (2) years after termination of this Agreement, whichever is earlier.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1 CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION. By virtue of this Agreement, each party may have access to information that is confidential to the other party. perturbation.explanation: The change reduces the confidentiality period from five years (or two years post-termination) to one year (or six months post-termination). This could potentially contradict California's Trade Secret Law, which protects trade secrets for as long as they remain secret and provide a competitive advantage. A one-year confidentiality period may be insufficient to protect certain types of confidential information, particularly trade secrets with long-term value, thus weakening the protection afforded under state law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Trade Secret Law (potentially), contract law regarding adequate protection of confidential information.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 TERM AND TERMINATION. This Agreement shall continue for a term set forth in Exhibit B, and may be renewed for successive one (1) year terms pursuant to mutual written agreement of the parties, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Section 12.1. Upon prior written notice, either party may terminate this Agreement if the other party becomes insolvent, ceases doing business in the regular course, files a petition in bankruptcy or is subject to the filing of an involuntary petition for bankruptcy which is not rescinded within a period of sixty (60) days, or fails to cure a material breach of any term or condition of this Agreement within thirty (30) days of written notice specifying such breach.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 TERM AND TERMINATION. This Agreement shall continue for a term set forth in Exhibit B, and may be renewed for successive one (1) year terms pursuant to mutual written agreement of the parties, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Section 12.1. Upon prior written notice, either party may terminate this Agreement if the other party becomes insolvent, ceases doing business in the regular course, files a petition in bankruptcy or is subject to the filing of an involuntary petition for bankruptcy which is not rescinded within a period of fifteen (15) days, or fails to cure a material breach of any term or condition of this Agreement within ten (10) days of written notice specifying such breach.
perturbation.explanation: The change shortens the period to cure a breach from 30 days to 10 days. This could be considered an unreasonably short cure period, particularly for complex breaches, and may be deemed unconscionable under California law. Courts often look to industry standards and the complexity of the issue when determining the reasonableness of a cure period. A 10-day period may not provide sufficient time to remedy certain breaches, potentially violating principles of fairness and good faith.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California contract law regarding unconscionability and reasonable cure periods.
